MANAGER - INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY AND BUILDING AUTOMATION SYSTEMS

SUMMARY

Manager - Information Technology and Building Automation Systems
Versatile Building Automation System engineer and IT professional with vast knowledge of Enterprise Project Lifecycle methodology and experience to deliver insightful network infrastructure and building automation solutions.
Network engineering expert with strong background in project management and product support.
Proven communication skills for quality development of standard documentation, as well as genuine leadership and assistance for associates and clients.
Highlights
Enterprise platforms Current PMP Certification Project tracking Hardware and software upgrade planning Certified Information Security Manager User experience (UX) design Self-motivated
Vast technical knowledge Server management Mac and PC expert Computer programming Highly motivated Resourceful Control system design Proficient multi-tasker

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Awarded the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal in 2010, 2011, 2012, and 2013 .
Awarded Sailor of the Year designation for the Pacific Naval Fleet in 2013.
Successfully managed the network infrastructure and server environment for 150+ users and 300+ PC and network systems.
Responsible for the training and development of 8 technicians and project coordinators within my team.

EXPERIENCE

Managed the 8 -person local IT team, allocating resources to ongoing projects and enforcing deadlines.
Conducted computer diagnostics to investigate and resolve problems and provide technical assistance and support.
Worked on large enterprise and business critical applications.
Analyzed and created new configuration for packaged software to meet business and system requirements.
Configured, maintained and provided trending and performance analysis of enterprise class storage systems.
Performed second-level support for all workstation and server class systems.
Served as the technical lead for server infrastructure including development, QA, staging and production systems.
Serviced electrical, pneumatic, mechanical and microprocessor controls.
Analyzed, modified and repaired digital control systems.
Set up, tested and configured networks, desktops, laptops and printers.
Created employee training materials and procedures to teach in-house workers proper software and hardware protocols.
Diagnosed, installed, configured and repaired computer systems and software.
Information Systems Technician

Utilized IT expertise to support communications efforts in Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation New Dawn, focusing on network security, Microsoft-based programs, and the installation and maintenance of affiliated hardware.
Demonstrated technical expertise to install, upgrade, and troubleshoot networks and related articles, such as video teleconferencing systems, routers, servers, computers, switches, and sound systems.
Entrusted with confidential information to successfully develop and review specifications, standards, protocol, and inventory data, as well as keeping numerous systems encrypted.
Maintained and monitored the server room, the wireless network and other server infrastructure.
Set up staff workstations with PCs, Macs, phones and laptops.Translated technical specifications into detailed product requirements.
Maintained audiovisual equipment, including overhead projectors, laptops and video conferencing equipment.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Technology Engineering Manager (Hybrid) Relocation Package Available

Location: Bloomington, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

Engineering Manager (Technology) (Hybrid) 

Our client located in the South Suburbs of Minneapolis is looking to add an Engineering Manager to the team. (High visibility position) The current Engineering Manager will be retiring later in the year (2024) This is such a great opportunity! The Twin Cities has so much to offer in your off time as well. Such a beautiful part of the country. The company does offer a relocation package as well.

Opportunity to work remotely 2 days a week.

The client is looking for an up and coming leader to develop complex audio communications and control products. You will lead and manage an incredible team of Engineers. In addition to working with a dynamic team, you will be working alongside their customers and play a critical role in aligning business and project objectives to drive innovation and success within the organization.

Interested in learning more? If so, please go ahead, apply for immediate consideration, additional information, complete job details, and see if this could be a great opportunity for all parties.

Highlights

Manage Cross-functional Engineering Project Teams and relationships with other Core Team members within the organizationWork to build credibility of the team by completing projects on-schedule and on-cost targetsProvide, hands-on technical leadership as well as technical contribution to projectsManage continuation / maintenance engineering projects as well as managing component availability / end-of-life issues for componentsManage product certifications and testing for safety and EMCCollaborate with Product Management to develop and document product requirementsEstablish and be accountable for schedules, budgets, milestones for projects as well as project cost and device cost estimates for products and performanceDevelop, monitor, and control strategic and tactical budgets covering staffing, capital assets, and expensesBuilding cross functional relationships to gain trust and efficiency in the organizationCoaching and developing staff members including both formal and informal trainingParticipate in the development of medium to long term product and technology roadmaps

Qualifications

BS or MS in Electrical Engineering, plus a minimum of 8 years of experience or equivalent blend of education and experience in product design and developmentMS in Management of Technology or an equivalent Technology-MBA degree preferredBroad technological expertise - comprehension and awareness of the latest technologies and the ability to maximize the impact of technology in appropriate discipline areasPreferred experience in complex high-speed digital and audio productsSome knowledge of wireless product desire is beneficialDemonstrated excellent oral and written communication skillsExcellent mathematical and analytical skills and working knowledge of signal processingDemonstrated ability to manage cross functional engineering projectsDemonstrated experience in the development of complex products which include electrical, mechanical, firmwareExperience with Phase-Gate control of projectsAbility to travel domestically and internationally up to 10%Must be a US Citizen due to working with the Federal Government and Security. 

Core Skills:

Knowledge of quality systems concepts and tools and their applications (experience with DFMA, DFT, DOE, and Six Sigma methodologies is helpful)Expertise with system issues relating to product design; EMI, ESD mitigation, grounding techniques, stray capacitance, distortion, and noise mitigationExpertise in designing products for international safety and EMC requirementsMust possess good communication skills and strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work in and lead a cross functional teamAbility to present complex concepts in a clear non-technical manner, making the complex, simpleStrong analytical and negotiating skillsMust be self-motivated, high energy and have a desire for team buildingNormal office environment with the ability to sit for extended periods. 

Visa sponsorship- Not authorized for this position now or in the future.

Relocation Package is available for out of area Engineering Manager.

Must be able to pass drug screening and criminal background check.

Annual Salary Rate: $140K to $170K (DOE) Plus annual bonus potential of 15%

KEYWORDS: Audio, Electrical, Mechanical, Digital, Engineering Manager, Video real-time communications, EMI, EMC

Company Description

The Nycor Group, Inc., with divisions ranked in the industry's "Top 25" by the Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal, is a firmly established, successful contract consulting, retained and contingency, search firm with a national reach. Celebrating 66 years, Nycor has built enduring relationships with clients ranging from emerging growth and dynamic technology companies to Fortune 500 companies. A 93% rate of repeat business in recent years attests to the high level of satisfaction enjoyed among Nycor's clients.

The Nycor Group, Inc., with divisions ranked in the industry's "Top 25" by the Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal, is a firmly established, successful contract consulting, retained and contingency, search firm with a national reach. Celebrating 66 years, Nycor has built enduring relationships with clients ranging from emerging growth and dynamic technology companies to Fortune 500 companies. A 93% rate of repeat business in recent years attests to the high level of satisfaction enjoyed among Nycor's clients.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
